intro: Pleurospermum pilgerianum, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow or orange blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has hairy, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Pleurospermum pilgerianum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
